quiz.question: What does a country calling code identify in international dialing?
options: The country or region of the destination number
The local area within a city
quiz.answer: The country or region of the destination number

quiz.question: Which of these area codes was part of the original 1947 NANP assignments?
Which North American area code was originally split from 212 to relieve demand in New York?
What type of service typically uses the 800 area code in North America?
What does LRN stand for in number portability systems?
Which country code is shared by both Russia and Kazakhstan?
Which digit range is allowed for the first digit of a NANP area code?
Which area code was one of the original NANP codes assigned to Illinois in 1947?
Which two countries share the country calling code +7?
What is the standard maximum length for international telephone numbers under E.164?
Which two-digit pattern was forbidden in the first digit of a NANP NPA historically?
Which symbol commonly indicates an international telephone prefix on phones?
Which of these is a common reason a region moves to mandatory ten-digit dialing?
options: Introduction of an overlay area code
Spin-off of the original area code
quiz.answer: Introduction of an overlay area code

quiz.question: Which area code split helped create area code 718 from the original New York numbering plan?
